content.label: I beat this game a while back, but the monotony of quarantine has brought me back yet again. This game beats all other on the App Store in creativeness, graphics, immersion, and gameplay. I really enjoyed how the currency was a bit hard to come by and needed to be spent wisely. Absolutely worth the money and I sincerely hope there will be more levels added on or a sequel in the future?? All in all an AWESOME game

This app looks like it has lots of content,  but after playing for 15 minutes you are out of missions. I think there is supposed to be more content but nothing is there. Absolutely not worth the money. I cannot believe this app passed the app store review.

This game is fun in a chaotic way. It’s a game that you can pick up for just a few minutes or you can play hours on end. You can feel how much fun the developers had when they were making the game because of the way they designed each levels with all the hidden gems and interactive objects (cor just chopping down trees for fun). The weapons are super fun in the game and all you have to do is to smash your buttons and destroy the enemies. 

This game is not super difficult as long as you watch your health from time to time. There is also healing station on every level. You can make the game more difficult by baiting all enemies to you at once. It’s not a cheap game at 8.99 but personally I find it very enjoyable.

It could be a really good game. But the control pad has really bad handling, the way to interactive with heath fountain and enter rage mode or whatever is just plain bad. Ruins it. THERE ISNT EVEN A PAUSE BUTTON?

Not really made for a phone. Text is too small. Controls are ok, but hard to see what's happening. Still have no idea what the goal is. Just keep getting surrounded and killed after a while, sent back and have some "money" taken. Rinse and repeat
Best game I’ve played on iOS in a long time.

Like everyone else I absolutely have to agree on the controls issue. They are fairly awkward and unresponsive a lot of the time. I also have to agree that it should be 30% of earnings to keep going or start off. Between the fact that everything is super small, and the rough controls, it is just way too easy to die and lose a big chunk of loot. 

Decent start but needs work. Especially because as is the game is way overpriced.

title.label: They deleted my first review because it wasn’t paid for.

content.label: First review already deleted. Don’t trust the ratings for this game, they have clearly been paid for. You can easily distinguish real reviews by consumers and paid reviews purchased by the developer. Don’t waste your money. I would give it higher ratings for the polish on the content available but there’s just not enough there to warrant the price tag, and the false reviews are super shady.

Hello,

I have found this weird bug. On my second and third play throughs of the game, the giant red button for the master classes never appears. 

Is this a problem anyone else is having or is there a work around?

title.label: One of the best games I’ve played

content.label: I decided to get Barbearian a few days ago. It’s an awesome game to play and it addicts you. I also love the fact that you get to build your own army. Yes, it’s hard. But so far I’ve been able to beat everything, mostly I just have to go back to old levels and get more soldiers or earn enough money to buy more stuff. Every level has new enemies that you have to choose a new strategy for. You also get tons of abilities and weapons. So far I’ve played about five hours in, and I can contradict some people’s reviews. The guy who said the thumb holds are tiny must have massive thumbs because the hand holds are made more for an adult man than a little girl. Someone said that it costs too much when you die, yes it’s annoying but he only takes 1/3 of your money, which is easy to recover from. To recover health it does cost money, but it’s cheap. Overall I rate Barbearian 5 stars. It was worth $9.

title.label: I greatly enjoy the game so far but the joystick....

content.label: This game is great I was kinda hesitant in the price tag but went ahead and bought it and I’m having a great time my only complaint is the joystick is way too small for me if possible could u make an option to increase the size of the joy stick.... thank you
This game is a serious fast-pace mayhem, and beautifully done. Loved every bit of it.
game!
The Game is great i love it!! but like i have an iphone X max the corner of the screen are gone 😭 an i cant play it well...make it competitive with the iphone x pleasee!
This game is fantastic, I don’t really particularly care much for touch controls and/or mobile gaming but this game has me hooked.  So much fun on iPad with a controller 👍👍

title.label: Updating my review for adding tvOS & iCloud feature

content.label: Thank you for the update

No pause buttons, the movement circle is too small, which makes for relatively lame deaths, the character feels rigid as well when it comes to attacking and you’re surrounded by mobs, right now I really don’t think this is worth 9 dollars

I regret paying $8.99 for this crap.

Inconsistency difficulty levels. Fix them.

This game would be simply amazing,  but the move pad is non responsive, inaccurate, and annoying.   

Would be 5* with good controls.

It's on the way but I remember the price being high and for me to say it's worth it is for the controls to get a little more polish. Feels a little clunky to move and with combat. Otherwise so far it's pretty good. I like supporting devs I only want to be sure the the price is fair for both.
Figures are too small. My eyes hurts after play 20 minutes on iPhone X
High quality games like this are very rare. Even tho it’s pricey, it’s more than worth it. Hopefully the devs can add updates to it so we can all enjoy more of it!!!

I love the premise and the aesthetics of this game. Overall, it’s fun and offers plenty of variety, with a new challenge in each level. But I really don’t like how my character’s movement is so slow and imprecise. Many times I’ve died because my character simply ignored my command to dodge. Maybe this was intentional to increase the difficulty, but it makes the combat less fun than in many action RPGs. Maybe it’s because of lag on my iPhone 6.

title.label: Great hack 'n slash, wish it was also on ATV

content.label: Great game. I just wanted action and that's what I got. I love that there is MFi support, but I also wish there was an ATV version as well.
It is a nice and well made game it is just boring. There is nothing that made me want to keep progressing. The upgrades feel unimportant.

There should definitely be a part two to this game, its amazing not to have an entire series of sorta for the game. I really enjoyed it and its one of my favorite all time games even from console and pc.
What a great game!!  Best action game on iOS now!
They need to add more stuff the combat. It’s really bearbones and dull. But all jokes aside it’s needs more.

Not even 30 minutes into the game and I’ve hit a breaking point. I try to run a level, die, lose all the level progress, and a huge chunk of what I earned from the level. This is really bad game design and promotes pointless grinding for items that really make no difference. The game is really pretty but that doesn’t give reason to the large price tag. Really upset with this game, lots of missed potential.

To re-iterate what others have mentioned the controls are horrendous and one would expect more detail in this area for the price.

Playing on the iPhone X, everything is small. Like “unBEARably” small. I can barely see the main character or enemies, or the in-game items for that matter. Not sure why no smart zoom feature was included for the price. 

A suggestion, wait until this item goes on sale and more time has been invested into the playability and user experience. As it stands, very linear and mindless mechanics paired with a subpar, disconnected visual experience for the price.

title.label: One of the best iOS games I’ve played

content.label: Very rarely I play an iOS game from start to finish, this is one is them. Very well made
Great game, but I’m stuck at 94% completion and there is no way to figure out what I missed. Frustrating.

Ok there is a definite need for revive potions to use in game because when you get the the 3rd map on each of the trials it’s incredibly frustrating to die and have to start all the way over especially after losing 30% of your total earnings not to mention the randomization of the map and being forced to leave the map and continue before you’ve rescued the villager I like this game a lot but being forced into the next level and having to start over after dying are the most annoying and rage inducing parts of this game and it makes me not really want to play it anymore I hope this review is helpful but for the love of all that is holy either add a revive potion or don’t start all the way over after dying
Something about the left joystick (movement) feels off on the iPhone X to the point where I’ll be running in the wrong direction or the character doesn’t move at all.

title.label: This is one of the best games ever

content.label: Finally this amazing developer built a game that feels like a console game and not a solitaire stupid game.   Well done (standing and clapping)

Fun for the 1st couple of days but repetitive. No storyline to pull you in, so by the 3rd day I completely forgot I had the game. For these reasons, $8.99 is way overpriced. Should probably be around $2.99 when comparing to other games in the AppStore.

title.label: The game is the best but

content.label: The game crash a lot, just by playing the game crash pleases fix this

Overall, I think this game is worth the $9 if you are up for the challenge and actually incorporate strategy into playing the game. 
It’s not just going head on and defeating all the enemies so easily. Many YouTube videos I have watched on this game, have players going straight into the horde of enemies/bosses and die. This is a result of not being aware of how the mini-bosses attacks or not managing their health. If you think the non-boss enemies don’t do much and the beginning is getting boring because it seems easy, KEEP PLAYING the game. Eventually it did get harder and I had fun learning how to beat these tough levels. The “end of chapter” bosses may seem hard at first, but once you learn how to approach the boss, it will be easier. There ARE Easter eggs that WILL get you to complete 100% of the game, so try exploring everywhere!!!

PS: I was wondering if I could upload gameplay, I didn’t see anything, but I’m just making sure. Thanks!

Enjoying a lot, but the game keeps crashing on me. 5 stars if this gets fixed.
_____________________

Edit: Update fixed crash problem. Thanks, devs!
The game is amazing. The animation to the battle. I just wish there’d be a way to save it Incase you go to a new phone or device. I haven’t seen one but I hope they implement one.

This game is an absolute blast! I’ve been playing for hours!

The only problem is that it’ll crash randomly about half an hour in. Please fix!

Edit: After the latest update, I’m crashing every 5 minutes. Please, I’m only half way through the game!!
Ok so this is one of the best games I’ve ever played on mobile. However, I’ve experienced several crashes that made me lose a lot of progress. Fix the crashing, 5 stars.

I’m a hard core gamer so I usually like games like these. I used my iPhone SE to play it and I could barley read the words. This game really requires a physical controller my touch screen was not effective at all. It could be a good game but it belongs on a console. It would have more stars if it was a $2 game but I spent $8 and could barley play it. Not worth the time if you don’t have a remote.

The game is overall amazing. I hope you keep working on it to fix the small bugs. I don’t care if anyone says it’s not worth 9 dollars, because for players who like games where you can slash your way through boards on monsters would love this game. It is one of my favorite fast pace games that is single player. I would love to see a multiplayer where you and another fight in an survival mode.The only problem is when I am playing a level or stage it makes me leave and I have to renter the game again, but not that bad of a bug.GREAT GAME

This is an awesome game but there is no pause button so when im in the middle of a level i cant just pause to get up and go do something i have to either let it sit if there are no enemies or finish the level

It has the makings of a great little game, although not in its current state and certainly not for nine dollars. The controls are finicky and unresponsive at best, the upgrades are surprisingly lackluster, your minions are just about useless, and boss fights are more chore than fun and challenging. 
Wait until this is on sale or until there are some deep changes and improvements.

title.label: Amazing game!! Please add endgame content

content.label:
Amazing game. Don’t listen to the negative reviews, they never played past the beginning stages. Keep with it until you start upgrading your minions. That’s when it starts getting really interesting

Please add endgame content. I beat it and I don’t want to stop. Just any excuse to replay the normal levels or some +game extra hard version would be amazing

title.label: Great game, just crashes (I deleted it)

content.label: Hey, if you’re reading this, the game is great. Only problem I have is that it crashes mid stage and it makes me so mad to the point where I deleted it because of it. Fix this problem and we will be good. P.s. I own an iPhone 8+, it’s capable of handling it.

This game definitely isn’t reinventing the wheel but it’s easy to pick up and play a level or two when you have a bit of down time and is enjoyable in how simple that act is. 

The biggest problem here is that the app is constantly crashing. Multiple times I have spent a decent amount of time on a level or boss only to have the game freeze and crash forcing me to restart that stage. Not what I would expect from a game in this price range. On an iPhone 8+.

I love a good hack and slash and this is among the best on the App Store. Very, very satisfying to mow down hordes of enemies either alone or with your army. Kudos on this beautiful, fun, and addicting game. It’s gonna be staying on my phone.

That said, will someone help me? I can’t find the last weapon anywhere! I’m fully maxed out on everything (72 soldiers and full spirit and health). I can’t finish Master Class as a result. Also, I can’t make a dent on the final boss. What am I missing?!
